basics.name: Peng Qin
basics.Title: Dr.
basics.summary: Peng Qin is a highly motivated researcher with a PhD in Building Physics and extensive expertise in computational fluid dynamics (CFD), urban ventilation, indoor and outdoor air quality, particle/gas dispersion modelling, and vehicle emissions modelling. His research spans from outdoor urban climate challenges to indoor air quality — from pollutant dispersion and thermal studies in urban areas to COVID-related indoor ventilation and aerosol dispersion studies. He is adept at large-scale numerical modelling in UNIX/Linux environments using ANSYS Fluent/OpenFOAM. He is passionate about addressing environmental health issues (e.g. contaminant exposure due to limited ventilation, urban overheating, and indoor/outdoor air quality) and supporting government and stakeholder policy and decision-making.
